column1: I joined @SteveDaines in urging the Treasury to give tribes more time to use the Coronavirus Relief Fund so they can complete their most significant pandemic response projects including the construction of health care facilities & improvement of water infrastructure.

Reminder that there are refundable payroll tax credits available to small and mid-sized businesses to reimburse them dollar-for-dollar for the cost of providing employee leave related to the COVID-19 outbreak. https://t.co/IGZgzM6rzK

One of the best steps Congress can take to better protect our seniors right now is to pass my bill to provide increased personal protective equipment and COVID-19 testing to our senior care facilities.
The deadline to claim your one-time coronavirus relief check is October 15. If you are eligible and have not yet received your check claim it here ⬇️ https://t.co/v1I9N5eHsw

The gridlock demonstrated by today’s partisan vote is exactly why Americans are frustrated w/ Washington. COVID-19 knows no party lines & I’d ask Congress to come together in a bipartisan way to defeat this virus.

NEW: COVID-19 has sharpened the digital divide in AZ’s Native American communities. Our new bill will help bridge that divide by investing in broadband connectivity and improving internet access in Native American communities for our tribal students and families.

.@UArizona's AZ HEROES project is looking for frontline workers to take a free weekly COVID-19 test at home to help protect families and assist in COVID-19 research. Learn more ⬇️ https://t.co/8eHQNax456

Exciting news: Abbott labs received FDA approval for its new rapid COVID-19 antigen test that delivers results in 15 minutes for just $5. This is a huge development that will allow more Arizonans to get tested as we continue to combat this virus. https://t.co/0FFYAmD1wQ
Arizona’s COVID-19 infection rate continues to drop! Let’s keep up the good work by continuing to: 😷 wear our masks 🧼 wash our hands ✅ stay 6 ft. apart

Great to see the Safeguarding America’s First Responders Act signed into law. Our bill will ensure families of first responders who lost their lives in the fight with COVID will receive the benefits they deserve. https://t.co/nXB0mUNvDM
Arizonans whose jobs have been impacted by COVID-19 should be able to stay on their health insurance through the end of the year. My bill would allow for that to happen. https://t.co/9NHjo54ZEr
COVID-19 has made clear that we MUST bring pharmaceutical drug production home to America. This EO is the right move by @POTUS. https://t.co/ZYNXKXP6kK

Americans who've lost their jobs or remain furloughed due to COVID-19 shouldn't have to worry about losing their health insurance too.   Our bill ensures they remain covered by their employers through the end of the year.

NEW: I introduced legislation w/ @JohnCornyn @SteveDaines & @SenDanSullivan to ensure that those whose jobs have been impacted by COVID-19 can remain covered by their employer's health plan through the end of the year giving Americans one less thing to worry about.

Americans who’ve lost loved ones suffered business losses or were personally harmed during the COVID-19 pandemic deserve the opportunity to hold China accountable and to demand just compensation.    https://t.co/TogSRm3Y04

Very pleased to hear the announcement that Arizona will receive 6000 more vials of Remdesivir in this 3rd week of deliveries from @HHSgov. This will add to AZ’s supply and provide needed relief to patients suffering from COVID-19.

The COVID-19 pandemic has cost hundreds of thousands of American lives. #China must pay for unleashing this virus on the world.  My bill allows Americans to sue the Chinese government in court and authorizes federal courts to freeze Chinese assets.  https://t.co/h54URTMsb8

🚨 I introduced a bill to give Americans the legal tools to sue the Chinese government in federal court for creating & worsening the COVID-19 pandemic. → https://t.co/oEbGzS2YQf   I was joined by @MarshaBlackburn @SenTomCotton @HawleyMO @SenatorRounds & @SenThomTillis. https://t.co/pBYKFtDYnv
ICYMI: Legislation I introduced with @ChuckGrassley and @SteveDaines would ramp up COVID-19 testing within senior care facilities and establish rapid response teams to assist nursing homes in crisis.

Today I spoke with the new @ypg_az commander Col. Ben Patrick McFall III about precautions the base is taking to keep our soldiers safe during the COVID-19 pandemic and how we can support the @USArmy's testing mission in Yuma.

Over the past several weeks I've urged @HHSgov to make additional payments to AZ safety-net & rural providers due to the COVID-19 surge in the state & I'm pleased to see the department do just that. This is a much-needed financial lifeline for our health care heroes.
I spoke with Arizonans from @AZMultihousing today to discuss how the CARES Act is helping homeowners and renters during the COVID-19 pandemic and what additional relief is still needed.

The coronavirus has disproportionally impacted AZ seniors. Our bill would ramp up COVID-19 testing within senior care facilities & establish rapid response teams to assist nursing homes in crisis. This bill will also help stamp out elder abuse & neglect.

I intro’d legislation with @SenRickScott to protect American families by expanding access to affordable COVID-19 testing. The fact that some insurers are denying or restricting access to these critical tools to treat patients early is unacceptable. https://t.co/DiWMCmymFS
Find a COVID-19 testing site near you. https://t.co/OBfWy2qSRH
.@HeroZonaOrg is extending its free COVID-19 testing in south Phoenix. Thanks to @apandassociates for leading on this!  https://t.co/PwP7KfbLLk

Our AZ rural health care providers serve some of our most vulnerable populations. I asked @HHSGov to send them COVID-19 funding ASAP so these providers can keep their doors open. https://t.co/7Q3rTzHc8b
Arizona’s tribal communities and economies have been devastated by the coronavirus pandemic. Today I asked FEMA to reduce the COVID-19 response cost-sharing burden for tribes. https://t.co/hKWMKyIef1

The Senate passed legislation that would extend the Paycheck Protection Program through Aug. 8 and keep this critical lifeline open to small businesses hard hit by the coronavirus pandemic. The House should pass this bill quickly.
AZ we can flatten the curve together! Wear a mask when you go out in public to prevent the spread of COVID-19. 😷  #MaskUpAZ https://t.co/0z2zbWSaqs
No one is immune from COVID-19. Protect yourself & your loved ones & #MaskUpAZ.   https://t.co/AB6AItL0Oe
Headed to Arizona with @realDonaldTrump & @RepDLesko to see the progress being made at our Southern Border (after all testing negative for COVID this AM). https://t.co/9v318FvZ6G

After passing telehealth expansions during COVID-19 Medicare beneficiaries increased their telehealth use by over 11000%. It’s time to make those expansions permanent & ensure access to this invaluable health care tool.

Health care provider shortages in rural American are painfully evident especially during the COVID-19 crisis. This week I introduced bipartisan legislation with @SenDougJones to expand patient access to health care through telehealth services. https://t.co/FfyY8uPwsn https://t.co/ucYajTZAlm

Yesterday I sent a letter to @HHSGov & @CMSGov asking for quick distribution of COVID-19 relief funds to hospitals serving low income & vulnerable Americans.   Today HHS distributed $10 BILLION to these safety net hospitals. https://t.co/eXF3Bw456e
Our community health centers continue to provide vital COVID-19 testing and treatment. Congress must send additional relief to them as we battle this pandemic. https://t.co/su1bXvCn4e

Beginning Tuesday AZ families can once again lay their loved ones to rest with the ceremonies they are due at national VA cemeteries in Arizona. Services were postponed for the past two months due to COVID-19. https://t.co/X6f1RWO7Pc

💧 Our bipartisan bill to increase clean drinking water access for the people of the Navajo Nation passed the Senate yesterday. A secure water supply is more vital than ever during the COVID-19 pandemic and I urge the House to pass our bill swiftly.

The coronavirus pandemic has underscored the significant risk of overreliance on China for medical supplies. I intro’d the SAVE Act w/ @SenKevinCramer to diversify our country’s medical supply chain & ensure America can maintain independence going forward. https://t.co/rLBUUAkmDa
It’s our duty to do all we can to protect the greatest generation from the coronavirus. This CARES Act funding will help protect our vulnerable seniors and their caretakers. https://t.co/ueQOFazWmh
Farmers and ranchers: you can now apply for financial assistance through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Learn more ⬇️ https://t.co/8laUqcBpyt

I introduced legislation with @SenRickScott to protect the United States' COVID-19 vaccine research from Communist China's ongoing attempts to steal our science & harm Americans. https://t.co/LjBIQyHtyb

AZ's skilled nursing facilities will receive $41.4M in additional funding to combat the coronavirus. This vital CARES Act funding will provide nursing home workers on the frontlines w/ more resources to properly protect themselves & our vulnerable seniors. https://t.co/gbnDhKqRSF

My bill would expand loan forgiveness under the Paycheck Protection Program to cover personal protective equipment & safety upgrades for small biz. As we reopen it is imperative that employees have the proper equipment to protect themselves & consumers from the coronavirus.
.@CVSHealth is expanding #COVID19 testing in Arizona. Find a Drive-thru test location near you here: https://t.co/dTQCbqLsdH

It’s time we held China accountable for the pain it’s inflicted across the U.S. I’m joining @Varneyco on @FoxBusiness at 7:15am AZ to talk about my STOP COVID Act which would allow Americans to seek justice.

Mikali Brit of Phoenix’s @HonorHealth Deer Valley Medical Center brings her A game every day & actively works to make the hospital a better place to care for patients. She met the challenge of the COVID-19 pandemic head on frequently caring for the sickest patients. https://t.co/xLandi74mi

Tina Spiridon of Green Valley’s Santa Cruz Valley Regional Hospital empowers her fellow nurses to be patient advocates. She has done an excellent job directing the hospital's Emergency Department Services and Inpatient Services during the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/XnJojKl1kZ
Amanda Merkley of @DignityHealthAZ’s Chandler Regional Medical Center has been a fearless leader for her team and the hospital throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/knSwH2oyVW

Jessi Holt of @FlagMedical voluntarily stepped up and assumed leadership at FMC’s Ft. Tuthill COVID-19 specimen collection site. She has provided on-site clinical leadership promoted safe process around PPE & organization while also swabbing hundreds of patients. https://t.co/fxxOiBXAMQ

As #NursesAppreciationWeek comes to an end I want to highlight some of the outstanding nurses at Arizona’s hospitals. Thank you to all of our nurses who continue to tirelessly care for the sick during the COVID-19 crisis.

Despite the fact that COVID-19 originated in China & they misled the world the masks many of us rely on during a pandemic (including the ones in Senate offices) were MADE in China!!! This is unacceptable. We must bring home manufacturing critical to national security—like PPE. https://t.co/AbEt57Tv2q

AZ’s nonprofits charities & houses of worship are taking care of those whose lives have been disrupted by sickness closures & job loss. I’m asking that we provide support for them in the next coronavirus relief package. https://t.co/bDvwlTofIi

Medicare & Medicaid lifted restrictions on coverage for vital telehealth services due to the coronavirus crisis. Now @SenatorShaheen and I are calling on TRICARE to do the same so our servicemembers & their families can access the care they need. https://t.co/ebe4CEo1as

Critical relief I fought for is headed to the Navajo Nation and all our tribal communities to bolster their COVID-19 response. This is the single largest investment in Indian Country in America’s history. https://t.co/0xzCmqNdB6
China is our adversary. We need to confront them economically by bringing our manufacturing home and we need to hold them accountable for their handling of the coronavirus. https://t.co/4bxSHEg8nW

Incredibly thankful for the Arizona nurses who’ve tirelessly cared for patients during the coronavirus crisis. It is thanks to these heroes that we will overcome this unprecedented challenge. #ThankYouNurses #ThankAZNurses https://t.co/BLpoomcBHW
I’m working with @realDonaldTrump to bring manufacturing like we saw today @Honeywell home to America and to hold China accountable for their cover-up of the coronavirus. https://t.co/hy9C2LokbU
Pleased to help secure $8 billion in COVID-19 relief for our tribal communities through the CARES Act. Today @USTreasury will begin sending out that critical relief to tribes. https://t.co/c4PjZcO5xY

Today @SBAgov announced that agricultural small businesses can now apply for EIDL loans. This is huge news for AZ farmers & ranchers hard hit by the COVID-19 outbreak. I've been pressing the Administration for this update & am glad to see it made.

I joined @SenatorTimScott in writing @USTreasury and @IRSNews and detailed 10 requests to help provide immediate relief to #OpportunityZones in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/6pnsWKB2XB
Sign up for my e-newsletter to receive the latest COVID-19 updates and resources right to your inbox.
We salute all of our Arizona health care heroes and first responders valiantly combatting the coronavirus! Thank you to @lukeafb and @aznationalguard for the flyover. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/ruVvuogtMZ

Thank you to @AmSafeSOARS for donating 2500 medical gowns to @maricopacounty today to protect our seniors & frontline workers at nursing homes & long-term care facilities. I visited their impressive manufacturing operation today & Maricopa’s COVID-19 response center. https://t.co/f6oSsEYUTY

Tomorrow afternoon be on the lookout for our Airmen and women from @LukeAFB and @AZNationalGuard as they pay tribute to our incredible health care heroes and first responders combatting COVID-19. https://t.co/HqHCgOSLWB

Spoke today with the Huachuca 50 who are looking forward to the completion of the @Fort_Huachuca Ground Transport Equipment Building project I helped secure funding for. We discussed keeping our men and women in uniform safe during the COVID-19 crisis.

COVID-19 has further highlighted the importance of investment in infrastructure for the Navajo Nation & other rural tribes. Addressing these needs has been a priority of mine on @IndianCommittee & I'll continue to advocate for funding. https://t.co/1AewaYTNeE

Our country is facing a serious mental health crisis as many experience increased isolation and uncertainty. I’m calling for a bill to establish a 9-8-8 national suicide prevention and mental health crisis hotline be included in the next coronavirus relief package.
This week I updated over 20000 Arizonans about COVID-19 resources during a telephone town hall. Missed the call? See what we covered and how we can help.
Caught up with Dave Zorn of @kaffnews this morning to share the latest on COVID-19 relief. Listen here ⬇️ https://t.co/8CrpkjUN35

This latest coronavirus relief package delivers aid where it’s needed most. It will provide more aid for mom & pop shops increase funding for hospitals & scale up testing in places like @uarizona. https://t.co/FOpPhX8vTn
☎️ATTN AZ vets: @VAVetBenefits is hosting a tele-townhall for Arizonans on THURSDAY @2PM AZ. Learn about the VA’s COVID-19 response & veterans benefits program updates by calling 844-227-7557.

Arizona’s rural communities have been hit hard by the COVID-19 crisis. I’m calling for a long-term solution for funding essential services including schools law enforcement and infrastructure. ⬇️ https://t.co/KfjnBc8d8m

Dear big banks: PPP is NOT your money. It is the taxpayers' money intended to be a lifeline for small businesses & to keep them from going under due to coronavirus. We expected everyone in America including you to act with grace & speed to rescue those most hurt by this crisis.

I’m partnering with @MarshaBlackburn to introduce legislation that will allow Americans to file lawsuits against the Chinese Communist Party for its role in perpetuating the global spread of the coronavirus. The Chinese government must be held accountable. https://t.co/bMydIvxTwy
Having trouble navigating the COVID-19 relief available to you? I answered some of the questions I hear most frequently from Arizonans. https://t.co/c5Fp55ZUYn
Kicking my morning off talking to @TeamCavuto about the Senate’s latest coronavirus aid discussions. Tune in to @FoxNews at 8:20am AZ.

Grateful to @GeneralBrnovich for joining my telephone town hall today to warn Arizonans about common COVID-19 scams. Remember: the government is not going to contact you unsolicited & ask for your personal financial information. Report suspected scams at https://t.co/lrkdU6GhTi.

.@MayoClinic in AZ is leading the effort to collect plasma from those who’ve recovered from COVID-19 in order to develop a coronavirus treatment. Thank you to Jack from Scottsdale for stepping up to donate! https://t.co/Dj9AVHPdG1

This afternoon I spoke with farmers from across Arizona about the impact of coronavirus on the food supply chain. I am working to get them the relief they need to protect their farms and continue feeding our nation.

The Chinese government must be held accountable for the pain its inflicted across the U.S. Our legislation will allow Americans to file lawsuits against Beijing for its role in perpetuating the coronavirus. https://t.co/aTrDFdtO5O

Spoke with real estate industry professionals from all over Arizona about the impact of COVID-19.  We discussed the ways we can help individuals and families remain in their homes as well was what can be done to ensure the housing system remains in tact.
Good morning AZ! 🌵 ☀️ I’m joining @Varneyco on @FoxBusiness at 7am AZ to discuss our COVID-19 response. Tune in!

The diligent efforts of our medical professionals who wake up every day & head to the front lines of the fight against the coronavirus will lead us to victory. I salute you.   My latest in @FoxNews ⬇️ https://t.co/luaodxKZ3b
Received an update today from FEMA Region IX Admin. Bob Fenton on FEMA’s COVID-19 modeling in AZ assistance for native communities and testing efforts across the state. https://t.co/cabrzjONZR
Great news: @UArizona will administer 250000 antibody tests to our health care heroes and first responders on the frontlines of the fight against COVID-19. #BearDown https://t.co/4KweY3hg8h

The WHO owes the American people answers for their failed & delayed response to the COVID-19 outbreak which has cost hundreds of thousands of lives globally. I joined a group of senators in sending a letter to WHO requesting an account of their response. https://t.co/KubXt5i9WN
State local and tribal governments can receive payments to offset the cost of COVID-19 through the Treasury’s new online portal. https://t.co/NPgDiMEfhV

Our CARES Act includes $288M to help Arizona college students and institutions disrupted by the COVID-19 outbreak. We want students to be able stay on track and continue their education without an additional and unexpected financial burden. https://t.co/fQp0veAM4A

Small businesses employ over one million Arizonans. It is crucial that we do everything in our power to ensure these businesses no matter how small can survive the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/9obwmcHB9D
Grateful to have a partner in @DougDucey to bring home this assistance for Arizona's hospitals tribes and coronavirus patients. We will prevail together!

BREAKING: $707M from the CARES Act is headed to Arizona hospitals & health care providers today! This grant funding will allow our health care heroes to use their discretion to purchase whatever they need to serve patients as we combat the coronavirus. https://t.co/TDfctgrSZh

It’s time to permanently ban wet markets. They are unsanitary inhumane and have been linked to both SARS and COVID-19. I joined a bipartisan group of lawmakers calling for a permanent global ban of these markets. https://t.co/inaj83kS6f
Great talk with Mayor Nicholls in Yuma today! We’re working together to ensure Yuma has the resources it needs to combat COVID-19. https://t.co/dGMRJGp291

TOMORROW: I’m hosting a telephone town hall with special guest Larry Kudlow the president’s top economic advisor to provide an update on the economic resources available to Arizonans during the COVID-19 outbreak.  Call 855-962-1520 to join us and ask us a question! https://t.co/Lap3A4VZkV

On #WorldHealthDay let’s take a moment to thank our health care heroes! These incredible men and women wake up every day and head to the front lines of our fight against the coronavirus. We will declare victory over this invisible enemy! https://t.co/L6AxC8hBNh

Couldn’t agree more. Chinese propaganda & WHO complicity cost American lives & muddled our COVID-19 response.  WHO’s Director-General should resign & China’s voting privileges suspended immediately. Congress needs to investigate WHO’s ties to China & reconsider funding levels. https://t.co/4OKrfCwMx1
China kept the truth on COVID-19 from the U.S. and from @WHO. I’ll discuss with Neil Cavuto on @FoxBusiness shortly. Tune in now.

Farmers in Yuma and across Arizona are a key part of the American food supply chain. I sent a letter to Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue requesting emergency relief for our farmers during the COVID-19 outbreak.  https://t.co/NVhBEkSlb0 https://t.co/NuKgWJbMdj
This is the right move to protect Arizona’s small businesses and non-profits who by no fault of their own are struggling to pay rent during the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/g3DOVxGZKq

There is a critical blood shortage across the U.S. due to COVID-19 so I’m doing my part by donating blood at @RedCrossAZ in Tucson. If you’re healthy and able to give I encourage you to make an appointment today: https://t.co/7TvIZzv1BQ. #AZinAction https://t.co/JHDGJ2odZh

.@WSJ is right: WHO bows to China & it’s harmed the global response to the coronavirus pandemic which is why I’m calling for the organization’s executive director to resign immediately. https://t.co/ug9i7MTcJV
Thank you to @POTUS for approving Arizona’s Major Disaster Declaration. Arizona is now eligible to receive more federal resources to support our efforts to combat COVID-19.
Got questions about the #COVID19 resources available to you?   We have answers: https://t.co/jy7ilDi46C https://t.co/H19TVApcq8

This is not a game @SenSchumer. People’s lives and livelihoods are on the line. We have to pass the coronavirus relief package TODAY. https://t.co/TpXjbMBpXF
What’s the hold up in the Senate on the COVID-19 relief package? I’ll tell @MariaBartiromo on @MorningsMaria just after 5am AZ.

If the Senate can’t come together in a time of great need no Senator should receive a paycheck—like millions of Americans. If the urgent COVID-19 relief package fails again I’m introducing a bill immediately to withhold Senators’ pay until Americans are put before politics.

I couldn't agree more @kyrstensinema. As we ask all Americans to sacrifice their livelihoods and alter their behavior to save lives we must ourselves model appropriate #coronavirus behavior. No one is too important to disregard guidance to self-quarantine pending test results. https://t.co/0zQx8yrJA4
Have questions on COVID-19? Call 2-1-1 for answers in English and Spanish from 8am-8pm daily. https://t.co/Zs3hSndptI

Arizona: I know practicing social distancing can make us stir crazy but the sooner we slow the spread of coronavirus the sooner we can go back outside to enjoy the natural beauty of our state. Let’s stay home & fight this together! https://t.co/tBQTb22SjM
If you think you may have the coronavirus #StayAtHome and call your health care provider. Learn more ⬇️ https://t.co/HiQi7jINSb

Up late with @ShannonBream to talk about what we’re doing to support American families impacted by the coronavirus crisis. Tune in @ 8pm AZ.
